CONCLUSION: Violation of Article 6 - Right to a fair trial

TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicant was born in DATE and lives in GPE .
CARDINAL . On CARDINAL DATE the applicants’ neighbours brought an action against her and other respondents , claiming adverse possession of a right of way on their land .
CARDINAL . DATE and DATE the proceedings were interrupted because of the death of a plaintiff .
CARDINAL . DATE and DATE ORG held several hearings and obtained the opinion of an expert .

CARDINAL . NORP Since DATE the proceedings have been interrupted because CARDINAL of the respondents died , his successor did not join the proceedings voluntarily and the plaintiffs failed to apply for the successor to be made a party to the proceedings .
